sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: Heritrix is the Internet Archive's open-source, extensible, web-scale, archival-quality web crawler. This document explains how to create, configure and run crawls using it.

sect1.title: Web based user interface
sect1.para: After Heritrix has been launched from the command line, the web based user interface (WUI) becomes accessible.
The path to it printed out on the console from which the program was launched (typically http://<host>:8080/admin/).

The WUI is password protected. The username is currently hardcoded to 'admin' with the default password of 'letmein'. The password can be specified at startup and users are encouraged to change it. The currently valid password will be printed out to the console along with the path.
The WUI can then be accessed via any browser. While we've endeavoured to make certain that it functions in all recent browsers, Mozilla 5+ is recommended. IE 6+ should also work without problems.

The inital login page takes the standard username/password comibnation discuessed before. In addition users can opt to have the WUI remember their login by checking the appropriate box. If that is done then the login information will be stored in a cookie and read from it during future login attempts. If this option is not checked then the login is only valid as long as the server's session. Once it times you, the user will need to login again.

caution.para: The access control to the WUI is not encrypted! Passwords will be submitted over the network in plain text.

sect1.title: A quick guide to running your first crawl job
Creating jobs and profiles
sect1.para: In order to run a crawl a configuration must be created that defines it. In Heritrix such a configuration is called a Crawl job.

sect2.title: Crawl job
sect2.para: A Crawl job encompassses the configurations needed to run a single crawl. It also contains some additional elements such as logs, status etc.
Once logged onto the WUI new jobs can be created by going to the Jobs tab. Once the Jobs page loads users can create jobs by choosing of the following three options:

listitem.para: This option creates a new crawl job based on the currently set default profile.

para.emphasis: Create new crawl job based on a profile

listitem.para: This option allows the user to create a job by basing it on one of the profiles offered up.

para.emphasis: Create new crawl job based on an existing job

listitem.para: This option allows the user to create a job by basing it on any existing job, regardless of wether it has been crawled or not. Can be usefull for repeating crawls..

sect2.para: Options 2 and 3 will display a list of availible options. Initially there is only one profile and no existing jobs.
As should be clear by now, all crawl jobs are created by basing them on profiles (see next chapter) or existing jobs.
Once the proper profile/job has been chosen to base the new job one a simple page will appear asking for the new jobs:

listitem.para: The name must only contain letters, numbers, dash (-) and underscore (_). No other characters are allowed. This name will be used to identify the crawl in the UI but it need not be unique. The name can not be changed later
A short description of the job. This can be edited later.
The seed URLs to use for the job. This list can be edited later along with the general configurations.
